text: .@NINDSnews A5. Cognitive decline related to stroke is called vascular dementia to distinguish it from other types of dementia. #StrokeTalk

RT @NINDSdirector: Top 3 causes of stroke- high blood pressure
column4: high blood pressure and high blood pressure! #STrokeTalk

text: .@NINDSnews A3. High blood pressure can cause blood vessels to burst
column4: causing bleeding in the brain -- hemorrhagic stroke. #StrokeTalk

text: @NINDSnews A2. Americans consume an average of nearly 4 grams of salt a day
column4: more than twice the recommended amount. #StrokeTalk

text: @NINDSnews A2. A stroke can sink you into depression
column4: but depression can increase your risk of having a stroke as well. #StrokeTalk

text: @NINDSnews A2. A2. Get checked for A-fib. It causes a fivefold higher stroke risk  -but many people don‚Äôt know they have it. #StrokeTalk
@NINDSnews A2. A2. Eat Tomatoes. Men with the greatest blood levels of lycopene were 55% less likely to have a stroke. #StrokeTalk
@NINDSnews A1. Stroke survivors may also have numbness or strange sensations. The pain is often worse in the hands and feet #StrokeTalk
@NINDSnews A1. Stroke can affect the entire body. One symptom can be complete paralysis on one side of the body
column4: hemiplegia. #StrokeTalk

text: @NINDSnews A1. A1. A person who's had a TIAs is 10 x more likely to have a stroke. So
column4: a TIA should be considered an emergency #StrokeTalk

text: @NINDSnews A1. A1. Each year
